message: that works, it will load data in progressively (like tail -f) and you can search the buffer while its doing it. Quite good.
eh not quite that, but the possibilities are intriguing enough
cat myfile.txt > (switch-to-buffer "*my-new-buffer*")

hmmm I was wondering if I could do something like this today, and there you go...

<long running process> | grep ERROR > (switch-to-buffer "errors")
also, elisp is at least as good as bash. :)
Emacs... will wonders never cease!
Another reason it's awesome... its TRAMP aware
cd /ssh:myhost:/etc
and you're in.
(after sshy business)
I would love to customize the eshell prompt. Any hint?
@justinlilly Does you eshell loads your .profile or .bashrc configs? Can you use git on it?
I *can* use git.
I'm also fairly sure it parses my configs, though I keep mine in ~/.bash_profile
though you can possibly just source them.
so... can use git, it doesn't load my configs and whatnot.
@tauil at least on osx, if you launch emacs from quicksilver or the doc etc.... it's not going to pick up your shell environment it seems. I'm always starting it from the terminal anyway
Love eshell, i've long wondered, Is there a custom-variable or something to specify the PATH?
@tedroden I believe it uses exec-path

(setq eshell-prompt-function
      (lambda ()
        (if (= (user-uid) 0) "# " "% ")))
@rwagasore there's the eshell-prompt-function variable
Tramp + eshell + ssh-agent integration == love
@markhellewell quick write up? I'd love to see what you do with that.
@bat isnt a JSON shell simply called the node REPL?
something like this: ls file1 sort:size "file with space" -> {"cmd": "ls", "args": ["file1", "file with space"], "sort": "size"}
no, I want it to have a more shell-like syntax
I want a json shell. JSON is pretty close to sexps IMO.
I'd like to be able to toggle a switch and have it echo back the JSON produced from plain text.
so it's not just that people won't accept anything that isn't entrenched
and I'd like quoted strings to be like json quoted strings so I could make them *exactly* what I want
...or paste it
what is it you like about shell syntax?
I like how it's got fewer symbols
how would that venerable workhorse the pipe be conceptualised in such a shell?
...and if I prefer in some case, to just type JSON
I've seen zsh get popular when there were things like rush (ruby shell)

@ravaa oh nothing beyond what comes out of the box! It's just super nice to be able to `cd` into hosts i have setup in my .ssh/config and have all the auth stuff taken care of (under ubuntu at least, have to manually add hte priv key under osx)
@rwagasore as i discovered to my detriment, there are implications for file
.. completions when you change the eshell prompt
and is less picky about order
but I like the google search syntax better -- feels more modern
@bat just build some macros and run ielm repl :)
BTW I still can't source my profile to eshell, :( When I use source ˜/profile it shows the profile file content in eshell o.O
@justinlilly Do you know how to open a file from eshell to an open or new buffer?
@tauil find-file ../foo.txt
Cool @ivey . Can I choose which buffer to open it?
there's find-file-other-window though. not sure if its very helpful
just standard emacs window management stuff. Not veryf amiliar though
find-file-other-window worked. btw do you have any clue about how to get my profile setup on eshell? thx

my problem was partial solved with this line in custom.el: (if (eq system-type 'darwin)
    (setenv "PATH" "/usr/local/bin:/opt/local/bin:/opt/local/sbin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin"))
